Package net.xqhs.flash.core.shard

Class AgentShardCore

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.xqhs.util.config.Config
      • net.xqhs.util.logging.Unit
        • net.xqhs.flash.core.shard.AgentShardCore
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, ConfigurableEntity<Agent>, Entity<Agent>, AgentShard, net.xqhs.util.config.Configurable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractMessagingShard, AgentShardGeneral, MonitoringTestShard
    public class AgentShardCore
extends net.xqhs.util.logging.Unit
implements AgentShard, java.io.Serializable
    This class serves as base for the implementation of agent shards.

    A shard can belong to at most one Agent, which is its parent (and, in Entity terms, its context). When created, the shard has no parent; a parent will be set afterwards and the shard notified.

    In the life-cycle of a shard, it will be constructed and configured, then started and eventually stopped.

    This implementation manages the configuration of the shard and the shard's state. It also extends Unit, so extending classes can easily post logging messages.

    This implementation exclusively manages the relation with the shard's parent, and as such:

    • the parent agent must be an Agent.
    • addContext(net.xqhs.flash.core.Entity.EntityProxy<net.xqhs.flash.core.agent.Agent>) and removeContext(net.xqhs.flash.core.Entity.EntityProxy<net.xqhs.flash.core.agent.Agent>) methods are final; extending classes can override parentChangeNotifier(net.xqhs.flash.core.shard.ShardContainer);
    • extending classes can access the parent agent by means of getAgent();

    Author:
    Andrei Olaru
    See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • AgentShardCore

        protected AgentShardCore​(AgentShardDesignation designation)
        The constructor assigns the designation to the shard.

        IMPORTANT: extending classes should only perform in the constructor initializations that do not depend on the parent agent or on other shards, as when the shard is created, the parentAgent member is null. The assignment of a parent (as any parent change) is notified to extending classes by calling the method parentChangeNotifier(net.xqhs.flash.core.shard.ShardContainer).

        Event registration is not dependent on the parent, so it can be performed in the constructor or in the shardInitializer() method.

        Parameters:
        designation - - the designation of the shard, as instance of AgentShardDesignation.StandardAgentShard.

    • Method Detail

      • shardInitializer

        protected void shardInitializer()
        Extending anonymous classes can override this method to perform actions when the shard is created. The method is called at the end of the constructor.

        Extending classes should always call super.shardInitializer() first thing in their implementation of shardInitializer().

        IMPORTANT: The note in AgentShardCore(AgentShardDesignation) regarding initializations also applies to this method.

        VERY IMPORTANT: initializations done in this method are done before all initializations in extending constructors.

      • configure

        public boolean configure​(MultiTreeMap configuration)
        Extending classes should override this method to verify and load agent-independent shard data, based on deployment data.

        If the shard is surely not going to be able to load, false will be returned. For any non-fatal issues, the method should return true and output warnings in the specified log.

        The method loads the parameters into shardConfiguration and locks them.

        IMPORTANT: The note in AgentShardCore(AgentShardDesignation) regarding initializations also applies to this method.

        ALSO IMPORTANT: overriding methods should always call super.configure() first.

        Specified by:
        configure in interface ConfigurableEntity<Agent>
        Parameters:
        configuration - - parameters for creating the shard. The parameters will be locked (see Config.lock() from this moment on.
        Returns:
        true if no fatal issues were found; false otherwise.

      • start

        public boolean start()
        Overriding methods should always call super.start() first.
        Specified by:
        start in interface Entity<Agent>
        Returns:
        true if the entity was started without error. false otherwise.

        Overriding methods should always call super.stop() first.

        Returns:

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Description copied from interface: Entity
        Queries the entity to check if it has completed its startup and is fully functional. The entity is running after it has fully Entity.start()ed and until it is Entity.stop()ed.
        Specified by:
        isRunning in interface Entity<Agent>
        Returns:
        true if the entity is currently running.

      • parentChangeNotifier

        protected void parentChangeNotifier​(ShardContainer oldParent)
        Extending classes can override this method to perform actions when the parent of the shard changes, or when the shard is effectively integrated (added) in the agent.

        The previous reference to the parent can be found in the first parameter. The current parent can be obtained by calling getAgent().

        Such actions may be initializations that depend on the parent or on other shards of the same agent.

        Extending classes should always call super.parentChangeNotifier() first.

        Parameters:
        oldParent - - the previous value for the parent, if any.

      • getShardData

        protected MultiTreeMap getShardData()
        Returns:
        the shard initialization data. It cannot be modified, and it is guaranteed to not be null.

      • signalAgentEvent

        public void signalAgentEvent​(AgentEvent event)
        The method calls is called by the parent Agent when an event occurs.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        event - - the event which occurred.

      • getShardDesignation

        public final AgentShardDesignation getShardDesignation()
        Description copied from interface: AgentShard
        Retrieves the designation of the shard, so that one can know what services the shard offers. The designation should be related to the interface that the shard implements.
        Specified by:
        getShardDesignation in interface AgentShard
        Returns:
        the designation of the shard (as an instance of AgentShardDesignation).

      • addContext

        public final boolean addContext​(Entity.EntityProxy<Agent> parent)
        Setter for the parent agent. If an agent instance is already a parent of this shard, removeParent must be called first.

        After assigning the parent, the parentChangeNotifier method will be called, so that extending classes can take appropriate action.

        Specified by:
        addContext in interface Entity<Agent>
        Parameters:
        parent - - the CompositeAgent instance that this shard is part of.
        Returns:
        true if the operation was successful. false otherwise.

      • removeContext

        public final boolean removeContext​(Entity.EntityProxy<Agent> parent)
        Sets the parent of the shard to null, effectively eliminating the shard from the agent.

        After assigning the parent, the parentChangeNotifier method will be called, so that extending classes can take appropriate action.

        Specified by:
        removeContext in interface Entity<Agent>
        Parameters:
        parent - - a reference to the higher-level entity.
        Returns:
        true if the operation was successful. false otherwise.

      • addGeneralContext

        public boolean addGeneralContext​(Entity.EntityProxy<? extends Entity<?>> context)
        Description copied from interface: Entity
        Creates a link from a subordinate entity to an entity containing it in some way.

        This method should only be used (as opposed to Entity.addContext(net.xqhs.flash.core.Entity.EntityProxy<P>) in the following cases:

        • when a context other than the direct parent of the entity is added; or
        • when the caller cannot know the exact type of the entity's parent; and
        • passing as argument an entity of the appropriate type is not possible.

        It is the responsibility of the called object to verify the correctness of the argument.

        The recommended implementation for this method is one that calls Entity.addContext(EntityProxy) after casting the argument to the appropriate type, optionally catching ClassCastException and returning false if such an exception occurs.

        This method should be idempotent (when called with the same argument): adding the same context multiple times (with no Entity.removeContext(net.xqhs.flash.core.Entity.EntityProxy<P>) operations in between) should have no effect.

        Specified by:
        addGeneralContext in interface Entity<Agent>
        Parameters:
        context - - a reference to the higher-level entity.
        Returns:
        true if the operation was successful. false otherwise.

      • removeGeneralContext

        public boolean removeGeneralContext​(Entity.EntityProxy<? extends Entity<?>> context)
        Description copied from interface: Entity
        Removes the from a subordinate entity to the specified context.
        Specified by:
        removeGeneralContext in interface Entity<Agent>
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true if the operation was successful. false otherwise.
